courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Introduction to Chinese Linguistics
courses.description: This course is an introduction to the basic concepts and theories in contemporary linguistics. Through a systematic examination of modern Chinese, the course will help students understand grammatical rules essential to the language, learn how to analyze Chinese grammar, improve their competence in using the language, and lay a good foundation for their future endeavors in linguistic studies.
courses.learning_outcomes:
修畢本科後，學生能︰
- 對中國語言文字、古代文獻有基本的了解；
- 能夠運用資訊科技（如資料庫、論文庫、古籍數據庫）輔助學習；
- 在學習中運用批判思考能力；
- 對日常生活中的語言或文學問題感到興趣並了解其價值。
courses.course_syllabus:
- 語言與語言學
- 中國語言的分類
- 漢語的語音
- 語音的組合
- 音系的比較
- 語素和構詞
- 詞類的劃分
- 基本的語法關係
- 句子的分類

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Exploring China: Words and Images
courses.description:
This course is an introduction to literary China by studying the dialogue between words and images in Chinese literature. It will examine the historical evolution of Chinese culture and literature in various forms at different times. Emphasis will be given to fictional works, films and culture of the modern and contemporary periods. Specific topics will be assigned together with audio-visual texts for weekly discussions.
Where does one begin to understand China with all its complicated history and culture? How can the knowledge of Chinese culture and literature elucidate and broaden the notion of the human with all its more-than-human implications? Can China and literature be used to generate meanings and ideas to explain the current (non)human conditions? Starting with these questions, this survey course focuses on three keywords: China, Literature, and the Human Condition to help students to gain knowledge about global Chinese and Sinophone culture, history, politics, and religion in the 20th and 21st centuries by using literary and visual texts as methods.
From traditional socialist realist fiction to sci-fi, from gender perspectives to queer voices, from environmental literature to articulations of the nonhuman, the course covers a wide range of writers in the larger Sinophone world, including mainland China, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Singapore, and Malaysia. The analytical and theoretical writings of the leading scholars of the field will also be discussed. For each week, a film is also assigned as supplementary material. Whereas the literary texts are in Chinese, the secondary readings are in English. The primary instructional language is Putonghua, but a bilingual (Chinese and English) classroom environment will also be encouraged.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for student who have taken CHLL1902
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of the course, students will be able to:
1) Increase interest and skills in reading and discussing Chinese literary works and films.
2) Identify the essence of Chinese literature that is implicit in their current culture of audio-visual media.
3) Discuss Chinese literature in relation to the major works of Chinese films.
4) Describe the underlying principles governing the adaptation of Chinese literature to films.

courses.course_syllabus:
1. 英雄本色：選讀《史記》相關段落，探究司馬遷的史識及其史詩文字，並論其如何影響中國哲學、史學思想之發展。
2. 情聖杜甫：選讀杜甫詠懷敘事之詩作，探究其作為「詩聖」乃至「情聖」的詩學意義。
3. 政教道統：選讀韓愈的經典古文，探究政統、道統與文統之建構，其及與道家、佛家之關係。
4. 江河歲月：選讀蘇軾的「赤壁文學」及若干遊記，探索文學與山水之關係。
5. 飲食男女：選讀若干以都巿、愛情、商業為主題的明清小說，以瞭解當時中國的都巿生活及文化，並反思現當代人的生活模式。
6. 文青慢活：選讀古典文學有關文士生活雅趣之篇章，瞭解古代文青的「慢活」方式及其心靈追求。
7. 魑魅魍魎：選讀《聊齋志異》及其他志怪名篇，探討中國文化中的「另類傳統」以及它與民間文學的關係。
8. 魂兮歸來：選讀魯迅之經典篇章《阿Q正傳》，並論魯迅於現代文學及文化研究之意義。

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Staging Love: Six Hundred Years of Chinese Romantic Plays
courses.description:
How to perform love onstage? In this course, we will explore Chinese romantic plays from the Yuan dynasty (1206–1368) to the early twentieth century. We will look at the changing status of romantic plays over these hundred years. Among the questions we’ll consider are: Are they entertainment or high art? Do they articulate subtle emotions or crude desire? Should they be kept private or publicly circulated? Students will be introduced to the plays staged in various theatrical traditions through a range of media forms, including literature, audio clips, and stage performances. The course aims to help students learn how love has been described, interpreted, and manifested differently in theatrical culture over time in China and how our conceptions of love are shaped by historical and social changes.
All assigned materials will be in English or accompanied by English translation, so no previous knowledge of Chinese language or culture is required. However, students are allowed to read the assigned materials in Chinese (if there is a Chinese version) and complete all the assignments and exams in either English or Chinese.
courses.learning_outcomes:
- Acquaint with the text, music, and stage performance of classical Chinese theater.
- Acquire conceptual understandings of and analytical approaches to “love” (qing) in the context of classical Chinese theater.
- Adapt creative methods (such as online discussions and podcasts) to interact with course materials.
- Develop basic research abilities and critical thinking.
- Reflect on our everyday life through what has been discussed in class.

Week 1: Introduction to the Class

Part I: Singing about Love
Week 2: The Earliest Love Songs in China (about 1000 – 500 B.C.): The Book of Poetry

Part II: What is Love?
Week 3: The Song-Yuan Period (1271-1368): Passion or Manipulation - The Story of the Western Wing I
Week 4: The Song-Yuan Period (1271-1368): Passion or Manipulation - The Story of the Western Wing II

Part III: What Can Love Do?
Week 5: The Ming (1368-1644): The Transcendental Love - Peony Pavilion I
Week 6: The Ming (1368-1644): The Transcendental Love – Peony Pavilion II
Week 7: The Ming-Qing Transition (1644-1708): Love and National Trauma - Peach Blossom Fan I
Week 8: The Ming-Qing Transition (1644-1708): Love and National Trauma - Peach Blossom Fan II
Week 9: The Early Qing: Love as Salvation - The Palace of Eternal Youth I
Week 10: The Early Qing: Love as Salvation - The Palace of Eternal Youth II

Part IV: Is Love Erotic or Virtuous?
Week 11: The Late Qing (1800s-1911): Erotic Women Played by Male Actors
Week 12: The Early Republic (1910s–1930s): Virtuous Love Performed in All-Women Shaoxing Yue Opera

Conclusion
Week 13: Final Review

courses.description: This course is an introduction to prosodic phonology and its application in Chinese, mainly focusing on theories, concepts and new techniques developed recently in metrical phonology. Students will be trained to analyse natural speech, prose as well as poetry in terms of rhythmic structures construed by prosodic units of mora, syllable, foot, and prosodic word, in order to lay a solid foundation for their future studies on language and literature.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Introduction to Chinese Lexical Semantics
courses.description: This course analyzes the lexical semantics of Chinese words from both a synchronic and a diachronic perspective. On the synchronic level, the course focuses on representative samples taken from Mandarin nouns and verbs to see how their lexical semantics can be described and analysed with analytical tools from both the structuralist and generative framework to better serve the study of Mandarin grammar and the compiling of Mandarin dictionaries. On the diachronic level, the course analyses lexical semantics of the counterparts of the Mandarin samples in classical Chinese to explore their differences and to find patterns of historical changes in lexical semantics of Chinese words.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: The Study of Chinese Pragmatics
courses.description: Pragmatics is the study of how people use language to convey meaning in specific contexts. This course introduces students to some fundamental concepts and theories in Pragmatics, with an empirical focus on Chinese. The topics that are covered in the course include (but are not limited to) presuppositions, conversational implicatures, conventional implicatures, speech acts, information structure, (not-)at-issueness, projectivity, etc. After taking the course, students should be able to apply theoretical tools in Pragmatics to analyze the role of context in meaning and the interaction between Semantics and Pragmatics.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Study of Cantonese
courses.description: This course aims to help students analyze the linguistic phenomena of Cantonese in a principled manner, mainly focusing on its sound system and its grammar. courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Li Ji
courses.description: This course studies the Li Ji, a classic of the Confucian canon which describes the social form, governmental system and ceremonial rites of the pre-Qin period. Through close reading of selected chapters of the Li Ji alongside with traditional commentaries and newly excavated materials, this course will examine the date, background and process of its compilation, as well as its philosophical outlook and the ancient system of ceremonial rites. Its significance in the study of Chinese classics and Chinese rituals will also be explored.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Scholar-Beauty Romance
courses.description: Popular during the Ming-Qing periods, “scholar-beauty romance,” or caizi jiaren xiaoshuo, deals mainly with romantic love between a handsome and talented young man and equally talented and beautiful young woman. While “scholar-beauty romance” had been traditionally disparaged in Chinese literary history, many important Ming-Qing novels cannot be understood without considering their relaiton to this particular kind of fiction. This course will examine the major themes and narrative structures of typical “scholar-beauty romance” in the late Ming and that of its variations in the Qing dynasty from diverse persepectives such as gender, materiality, commerce, and ritual studies.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Chuanqi and Kun Opera in the Ming-Qing Period
courses.description: The course investigates the development of chuanqi song-drama in the Ming-Qing period. It familiarizes students with the literary, musical, and staging characteristics of chuanqi through case studies of selected plays. In addition to in-depth discussions about chuanqi texts, the course introduces students to the contemporary stage performance of Kun Opera, a theatrical tradition that has been performing chuanqi since the late Ming. The course aims to help students acquire a comprehensive understanding of the history, literary qualities, and performing aesthetics of classical Chinese theater after the Yuan zaju.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Modern Chinese Literature and Film
courses.description:
The aim of this course is to familiarise students with the dialogic relationships between modern Chinese literature and Chinese film from a historical perspective. Thematically organised, this class will help students understand the development of both literature and film in modern China by discussing such key issues as aesthetic presuppositions, temporal and spatial settings and interpretative strategies.
The sub-theme of this year’s course is the hometowns of words. What is a hometown? Is it always a place of birth? What are the relations between writers and their hometowns, real or imagined? Where are the old and new literary hometowns of global Chinese literature? How do these spaces and places condition literary productions, register historical events, and reveal socio-cultural transformations? How do they index our feelings of nostalgia, anxiety, loss, and more?
Starting with these questions, this survey course invites students to embark on a journey to travel across different lands of global China and the Sinophone world from the Mainland to Taiwan, Hong Kong to the South Seas, central plains to the borderlands, and the Earth to the cosmos. While mapping the literary cartography, the course also functions as a gateway to introduce modern and contemporary Chinese and Sinophone culture and history in the 20th and 21st centuries. From traditional socialist realist fiction to sci-fi, from gender perspectives to queer voices, from environmental literature to articulations of the nonhuman, the course covers a wide range of writers who write at/about/away from home. On this journey, the analytical and theoretical writings of the leading scholars of the field will also be discussed. For each week, a film is also assigned as supplementary material. The secondary readings are all in English.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Creative Writing
courses.description: This course introduces students to the techniques and process of creative writing, and enables them to heighten their creative awareness through writing in different genres and taking part in the discussion of their own assignments.
courses.learning_outcomes:
修畢本科後，學生能︰
- 了解文學的基本知識及源流發展，能夠描述不同文學作品的特點，並運用文學術語、概念或理論分析作品；

- 能夠準確、流暢地運用中文來表達思想和感受；

- 在學習中運用批判思考能力；

- 在學習、導修與功課上表現一定的創意；

- 對日常生活中的語言或文學問題感到興趣並了解其價值。
courses.course_syllabus: 圍繞不同文學議題，閱讀及分析名家作品，並進行不同文體的創作與討論。
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. 教師經常徵詢學生對授課進度、課程設計、教學方式及個人學習的意見，俾能及時調整教學方針。

2. 為學習出現問題的學生提供個別輔導。

3. 利用導修報告處理部分教學單元，俾學生主動學習，加強學生及教師之間的教學互動。

4. 利用網上討論，加強學生及教師之間的教學互動。

5. 通過學習、習作及論文撰寫，了解學生的整體表現。

6. 通過教學問卷調查，全面了解學生對本科教學的意見。

courses.description: This course introduces students to modern Chinese prose. courses.description: This course introduces students to modern Chinese short stories and novellas. By reading selected works of major authors, this course investigates the thoughts, the artistry and the significance of modern Chinese short stories and novellas. Topics for further discussions may include the relationship between classical Chinese fiction and modern Chinese short stories and novellas, the influence of foreign fiction on modern Chinese short stories and novellas, and their artistic features.

courses.description: This course examines the continuing dialogues between classical and modern Chinese dramatic traditions through careful analysis of paired texts that speak to enduring themes in Chinese theatrical arts. By placing works from different historical periods in conversation with each other, we explore how dramatists across time have engaged with fundamental questions about human nature, social justice, political power, and artistic expression. The course emphasizes close reading of dramatic texts while considering their performance contexts, theoretical frameworks, and cultural significance.

courses.course_syllabus:
Week 1: Introduction to Chinese Theater: Tradition, Innovation, and Performance
第一週：中國戲劇導論：傳統、革新、表演

Required Texts or Multimedia Materials 必讀和必看:
2025春晚小品《借傘》

Week 2: What is Theatre and What is Chinese Theatre: Theoretical Frameworks, Aesthetics, and Theatricality
第二週：何謂戲劇，何謂中國戲劇：理論架構、美學、戲劇性

Required Texts or Multimedia Materials 必讀和必看:
Wang Guowei 王國維《宋元戲曲史》selections on aesthetics
Huang Zuolin 黃佐臨《我與寫意戲劇觀》on traditional and modern staging

Week 3-4: Theater Reform: Birth, Evolution, and Transformation
第三至四週：戲劇改革：誕生、演進、蛻變

Required Texts or Multimedia Materials 必讀和必看:
齊如山《齊如山談梅蘭芳》
洪深《洪深戲劇論文集》
熊佛西《熊佛西戲劇文集》

Recommended Readings 推薦閱讀:
劉思源 Siyuan Liu:
\* \*Transforming Tradition: The Reform of Chinese Theater in the 1950s and Early 1960s\*
\* \*Performing Hybridity in Colonial Modern China\*

Week 5-6: Theatrical Forms and Media: Stage, Screen, Digital
第五至六週：戲劇形式和媒介：舞臺、銀幕、數碼

Required Texts or Multimedia Materials 必讀和必看:
戲曲電影：《生死恨》《花為媒》《雁蕩山》
戲曲動畫：《大鬧天宮》
遊戲文本：《黑神話·悟空》

Week 7: Revolution and Model Opera: Politics, Performance, Ideology
第七週：革命、樣板戲：政治、表演、意識形態
Guest Lecture by Barbara Mittler

Week 8-9: Meta-theater: Reflection, Memory, Dreams
第八至九週：元戲劇：反思、記憶、夢境

Required Texts or Multimedia Materials 必讀和必看:
湯顯祖《牡丹亭》
白先勇《遊園驚夢》
賴聲川《暗戀桃花源》
邱炯炯《椒麻堂會》

Week 10-11: Gender, Performativity and Theater: Identity, Representation, Power
第十至十一週：性別、表演性與戲劇：身分、再現、權力

Required Texts or Multimedia Materials 必讀和必看:
李漁《無聲戲·男孟母教合三遷》
京劇《霸王別姬》
崑曲《思凡》
周慧玲《少年金釵男孟母》
陳凱歌《霸王別姬》
川劇《思凡》

Week 12-13: What Can Theater Do: Power, Rebellion, and Poetic Justice
第十二至十三週：戲劇的力量：權力、反抗與詩性正義

Required Texts or Multimedia Materials 必讀和必看:
元雜劇《感天動地竇娥冤》
明傳奇《寶劍記·夜奔》
崑曲《夜奔》

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Modern Poetry Workshop
courses.description: In this workshop students will read and write various types of modern poetry, through which they will master the language, techniques and styles characteristic of modern poetry, and acquire a deeper understanding of the creative possibilities of poetic writing. Students are also required to take part in discussions on the poetic works of contemporary writers and fellow classmates. By sharing the experience of reading and writing poetry, students will sharpen their creative sensibilities, build their poetic visions and develop their personal styles.
courses.learning_outcomes:
修畢本科後，學生能︰

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Travel Writing
courses.description: This course introduces students to the key concepts and theories of travel writing. Through an in-depth study of selected works, the relationship between travel writing and society will be examined, and the artistic quality of travel writing will be evaluated.
courses.learning_outcomes:
學習本科目後，學生將能夠：
1. 解說與旅行書寫相關的概念和理論；
2. 描述在中國內地、台灣、香港等華語地區中，重要旅行書寫議題的內容；
3. 對既有議題提出個人意見，或提出新的議題；
4. 比較不同旅行書寫作品的特點，並評價其藝術性。

Upon completion of the course, students are expected to be able to:
1. Explain the key concepts and theories related to travel writing.
2. Describe major issues related to travel writing from Mainland China, Taiwan and Hong Kong.
3. Critically analyse the current issues or raise new issues.
4. Compare the characteristics of different travel writings and evaluate their artistic quality.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Hong Kong Wen-yi Film Studies
courses.description: “Wen-yi film” is one of the most important genres of Chinese cinema. Wenyi/letters and art, was a loan word from Japan, and heavily associated with literature and the concept of humanism. The aim of this course is to familiarize the students with the dialogic relationship between literature, art, literary theories, and Hong Kong cinema. This course will help students understand how the Wen-yi genre developed as a distinct historiography in film scholarship, and its importance in Chinese film history and criticism.
courses.learning_outcomes:
－ 了解電影語言的基本特色
－ 掌握文藝電影的基本發展源流，能夠描述不同文藝作品的特點，並運用文藝及電影術語、概念或理論分析作品
－ 能夠運用資訊科技（電影頻道、資料庫、論文庫）輔助學習
－ 在學習中運用批判思考能力
－ 對香港文化、文學和電影語言、文藝問題感到興趣及了解其價值

－ Understand the basic characteristics of the film language
－ Master the development of the “Wen-yi film” and be able to describe the characteristics of different literary and artistic works, and the use of literary and film terms, concepts or theories
－ Be able to use information technology (eg. movie channels, databases, thesis libraries) to assist learning
－ Use critical thinking skills in learning
－ Understand the artistic values of Hong Kong's literature, culture and film
courses.course_syllabus:
－ 文藝電影的源流 （討論文學、藝術、人文主義與電影之間的互動關係）
－ 上海文藝電影與文學及流行文化的關係 （改編中外名著及模仿好萊塢電影）
－ 戰後香港粵語文藝電影所呈現的人文主義與社會關懷
－ 戰後香港國語文藝電影與摩登社會／現代性的思考
－文學改編電影
－ 改編自中國文人生平的電影 （顧城、蕭紅）
－ 香港電影新浪潮與文藝電影
－ 王家衛美學與文藝電影
－香港九七情結與文藝電影
－ 女性文藝與香港電影
－ 從跨國電影節角度看香港文藝電影

courses.description: The course is designed to help students appreciate the importance of philology and paleography vis-à-vis the study of ancient texts. Textual corpus will be used to illustrate the contributions that material and data about ancient characters are the bases for the study of dating, transmission, and composition of early documents. courses.description: The emphasis of the course will be on theories, methodologies and principles in exegetical studies. It will examine patterns of etymological derivation and semantic development so as to facilitate the study of Chinese classics.
courses.learning_outcomes:
修畢本科後，學生能︰
- 對中國語言文字、古代文獻有基本的了解；

- 能夠運用資訊科技（如資料庫、論文庫、古籍數據庫）輔助學習；

- 能夠準確、流暢地運用中文來表達思想和感受；

- 在學習中運用批判思考能力；

- 在學習、導修與功課上表現一定的創意；

- 對日常生活中的語言或文學問題感到興趣並了解其價值。
courses.course_syllabus:
單元一　訓詁的名義及起因
單元二　訓詁構成的方式
單元三　求訓詁的程序
單元四　形訓
單元五　聲訓
單元六　義訓
單元七　爾雅和說文解字

courses.title: Chinese Dialectology
courses.description: This course offers a basic introduction to dialectology and a general survey of the history and development of Chinese dialects. The training stresses both theory and practice. It is designed to improve students’ ability to observe, describe and analyze linguistic phenomena, and to apply their knowledge in different areas of language studies to a comprehensive investigation of Chinese dialects.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Zuo Zhuan
courses.description: This course studies the Zuo Zhuan, a commentary on the Spring and Autumn Annals, held as a model of literary style and narrative technique. Through reading of selected chapters from the book along with traditional commentaries and new research outputs, this class will examine the book’s relation to other classics of the Confucian canon, its terse writing style, and its literary beauty. The significance of the book in the field of classics, historiography, and literature will also be discussed.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Lu Shi Chun Qiu
courses.description: This course introduces students to the Lu Shi Chun Qiu, with a specific focus on its background, time of completion, and the organization of book chapters. This course also examines the doctrines of the Lu Shi Chun Qiu and their origins by a detailed study of its main chapters.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Xun Zi
courses.description: An introduction to the Xun Zi, with an emphasis on Xun Zi’s thought, such as the ideas of xing e, quan xue, and tian lun, as well as his literary style. The Xun Zi’s influence on the Confucian philosophy of the pre-Qin period will be examined. In addition, the relationship between the Xun Zi and Confucianism, Daoism, and Mohism will be analyzed.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Selected Topics on Excavated Texts I
courses.description: This course aims at a close reading and analysis of newly excavated bamboo manuscripts of the Warring States period. By cross-examining transmitted texts and excavated manuscripts, this course will not only help students grasp the methodology of “dual evidence” but also keep them abreast of the latest developments in the research on ancient texts and history. This course will lay a good foundation for students’ future endeavors in advanced research in the field.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Selected Topics on Excavated Texts II
courses.description: Through detailed investigation into a wide variety of selected excavated texts of differing periods, this course aims to demonstrate an approach to comprehend Chinese civilization and culture through the lens of Chinese characters that are closely associated with our everyday life, and to develop a deeper understanding among students upon the evolution of Chinese characters, the general rules governing the interchangeability of characters based on homophones, as well as the habits of the usage of characters. In addition, students are also expected to grasp how to search and make good use of the excavated texts, and to recognize the importance of Chinese characters in determining the authenticity of the unearthed cultural relics. By so doing, the course essentially lays a solid foundation for the study of ancient Chinese civilization in the future.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Honglou meng
courses.description: This course provides students with an understanding of the Honglou meng with regard to its narrative structure, themes, and intertextuality. The relationships between this novel and its author as well as its commentators will also be examined.
courses.learning_outcomes:

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Literature and Art
courses.description: This course introduces students to various artistic media, including music, painting, drama and film, and their relationships with and influences on creative writing and literary criticism. Through a close study of concrete examples, this course examines the characteristics of different artistic media, and enhances students’ understanding of literature as a special form of art.
courses.learning_outcomes:
修畢本科後，學生能︰
1. 掌握文學與其他藝術媒介的不同特性；

2. 理解不同藝術媒介對文學創作與文學批評發展的影響；

3. 理解不同藝術媒介的獨特概念及理論如何應用於文學批評。
courses.course_syllabus:
一、導論：比較文學視野下的「文學與藝術」研究
二、文學與音樂（一）：文學與音樂意象的對應
三、文學與音樂（二）：文學中的音樂曲式和象徵
四、文學與音樂（三）：從音樂結構到文學、文化形式的探討
五、文學與繪畫（一）：文學中的形象思維
六、文學與繪畫（二）：繪畫技法在文學作品中的體現
七、文學與繪畫（三）：中國現代文學與西方現代藝術意識
八、文學與建築：城市、建築與中國現代文學
九、文學與影視媒介（一）：中國現代文學與二十世紀影視媒體的發展
十、文學與影視媒介（二）：文學、大眾媒體和意識形態
十一、文學與影視媒介（三）：「改編」的文化身份
十二、總結：文學與「非語言」藝術關係再議

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Modern Literary Criticism
courses.description: This course introduces students to different trends of modern western literary criticism and their influence upon Chinese literary criticism of the 20th Century. It aims at enhancing students’ understanding of the principal concepts of various literary trends, and examining both the possibility and limitations of applying western theories to the study of Chinese literary works.
courses.learning_outcomes:
修畢本科後，學生能︰
1. 學習二十世紀西方現代文學批評的各種流派，及其對中國文學批評發展的影響；

2. 掌握二十世紀西方現代文學批評的重要概念，並能應用分析文學作品；

3. 理解二十世紀西方文學批評方法應用分析中文文學作品的可能性和限制。

一、導論：二十世紀西方文學批評發展的若干線索
二、從「作品」、「文本」到「文學場域」
三、語言學與俄國形式主義文學批評
四、結構主義文學批評
五、新批評
六、精神分析與文學批評
七、(新)馬克思主義文學批評

八、接受美學與接受研究
九、解構主義文學批評
十、女性主義文學批評

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Hong Kong Literature
courses.description: This course gives a survey of the development of Hong Kong literature by reading the works of major authors. The relationships between literature and history, as well as between literature and society, will be emphasized. The artistic quality of Hong Kong literature and its place in modern Chinese literature will be evaluated.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Chinese Women Writers
courses.description: The aim of this course is to explain the major features of literature by women writers active from 1919 to 1949. By case studies, students will acquaint themselves with the works and thoughts of major modern women writers. Lectures will be arranged thematically, and the literary works will be examined in relation to their social, political and historical backgrounds.

courses.title: Modern Chinese Literature and Culture
courses.description: This course aims to familiarize students with the relationship between modern Chinese literature, ideology and culture, and broaden their horizons regarding transculturality. This course discusses representative cases among different themes such as “tradition and modernity”, “foreign and local”, “enlightenment and national salvation” etc., and hence explores how Chinese intellectuals "rebuild civilization" in the twentieth century.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Lu Xun
courses.description: Many consider Lu Xun (1881-1936) the most important modern Chinese writer, whose influence on twentieth-century Chinese literature is unmistakable. This class will read closely his representative short stories and essays, and delve into his involvements in various literary activities, movements and debates. Lu Xun’s ideas, writing style, and his contribution to modern Chinese literature will be explored.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Contemporary Chinese Literature and Disaster Narratives
courses.description:
Why does the Chinese-speaking and -writing world matter in our studies of ecological and social disasters worldwide? How do the narratives and cases from global Chinese literature, film, and cultures illuminate the meanings of “disasters in narratives” and “narratives about disasters” in various crises? Using disasters and crises as methods, this course studies the major themes and trends in modern and contemporary Chinese literature across China’s mainland, Taiwan, Hong Kong, and Malaysia by treating disasters broadly as ecological and social-cultural catastrophes. The course attempts to (1) address the socio-cultural and historical background for understanding various disasters in the global Chinese-speaking and -writing world; (2) construct a literary lineage on major texts and arguments about disasters; (3) explore new contingent connections between China and the world by using disasters as an interpretive framework and lens.
We will cover issues on mythologies and history, ecologies and pollutions, religion and technology, and posthuman transcendence and human-nonhuman entanglements. The texts selected include writers of conventional realist fiction, speculative fiction, and science fiction, occasionally accompanied by films and documentaries. The fields of engagement include ecocriticism, posthumanism, global Chinese studies, film studies, disaster studies, modern Chinese literature, gender, and ethnicity. The thinkers and intellectuals whose works are covered include Achille Mbembe, Agamben, Brian Bernards, Carlos Rojas, David Wang, Derrida, Foucault, Haraway, Jing Tsu, Karen Thornber, Lawrence Buell, Mingwei Song, Rob Nixon, Shu-mei Shih and more.

- 鍛煉和演繹批判思考的能力和技巧；

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Ecology and Technology in Sinophone Media Culture
courses.description:
This course introduces students to three key concepts in contemporary humanities studies: media, technology, and ecology. Its goal is to contextualize these concepts through the lens of Sinophone literature and culture, and to trace a history of interaction from late Qing to present between media technology, human sense perception, and the environment. Students will learn to think through questions including, What is media technology? How and when did visual modernity emerge in China? How has experience been shaped in relation to changed perceptions of the technologized environment in the Sinophone world? How does media thinking help pry open an ethical dimension that reorients eco-techno-social relations while reaching out to the more-than-human world?

Weekly topics include the reception and practice of anatomy in modern China; the sensory politics of mass media; East Asian extractivism; visual politics and animal experiment; air and atmosphere; coral and nuclear imagination; cetaceans as media, etc. Materials range from science fiction to popular science, nature writing to oral history, late Qing pictorials to contemporary documentary image. In addition to deepening students’ understanding of the texts and issues under discussion, the course also trains them to think critically – to reflect on how they can sense and act better as members of an interconnected Sinophone community.

courses.description: This course will introduce students to the contents and stylistic principles of Guangya and Guangya shuzheng. courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Shuowen Jiezi and Modern Philology
courses.description: From a modern philological point of view, this course introduces the classical dictionary, Shuowen Jiezi, and highlights the significance of the system it embodies in paleography, semantics, lexicology and phonology. Students are expected to have a systematic understanding of the composition of characters, the extension of meanings, and the variation of sound change. This course will help students master the basic theories and methods in analyzing written forms, word meanings and lexical changes, laying a solid foundation for academic research and future studies in philology.

courses.title: Comparative Study of Cantonese and Putonghua
courses.description: Through lectures and exercises, students are introduced to fundamental theories and methods in the field of comparative linguistics. They will examine the similarities and differences, phonological, lexical and grammatical, between Cantonese and Putonghua. Students will be able to make use of such knowledge at work or in their teaching practices. This course will also improve their proficiency in Putonghua and literary Chinese, as well as their teaching of these subjects.

courses.description: This course aims to help students analyze the grammatical structures of Cantonese in a principled manner, mainly focusing on syntax and syntax-semantics interface of Cantonese. 1. To acquire an in-depth knowledge in ancient Chinese texts, and to enhance skills in critical thinking and ability to conduct independent study.

3. To attain an advanced level of reading and writing skills in Chinese, and especially to master skills in academic writing.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Sanyan
courses.description: This course examines some of the representative stories culled from Illustrious Words to Instruct the World, Comprehensive Words to Admonish the World and Lasting Words to Awaken the World, which are also known as Sanyan, the three collections of vernacular short stories compiled by Feng Menglong of the Ming Dynasty. Through a close and critical reading of these texts, students will understand the narrative perspectives, structures and meanings of Sanyan, as well as the compiler’s moral stance and the relationship between fiction and history. Traditional and modern scholarship on Sanyan will also be introduced.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Pre-Qin Myths
courses.description: Pre-Qin myths constitute an important part of traditional Chinese culture, and are pivotal to the development of Chinese literature. courses.description: Critical study of major issues in modern Chinese literature. Topics include genres, literary works, literary thoughts, literary debates, regional literature, comparative literature, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MA Chinese Language & Literature
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. To acquire an in-depth knowledge in modern Chinese literature, and to enhance skills in critical thinking and ability to conduct independent study.

2. To develop both intellectual and technical abilities on research of Chinese language, literature and culture, and to familiarize with the general trends and recent findings in the research field.

3. To attain an advanced level of reading and writing skills in Chinese, and especially to master skills in academic writing.

1. 增進同學對中國現代文學的深入認識，並提升批判思考和獨立研究的能力。

2. 具備中國語言、文學及文化課題的研究能力，並了解相關研究範疇的發展趨勢及最新研究成果。

3. 提升中文閱讀和寫作的能力，並掌握學術論文的寫作方法。
courses.course_syllabus: 任教老師將就所選專題，提供課程大綱。
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. 導師經常徵詢學生對授課進度、課程設計、教學方式及個人學習的意見，俾能及時調整教學方針。

2. 為學習出現問題的學生提供個別輔導。

3. 利用導修報告及小組討論處理部分教學單元，俾學員主動學習，加強學員及導師之間的教學互動。

4. 利用 Blackboard Learn 的網上討論，加強學員及導師之間的教學互動。

5. 通過學習及論文撰寫，了解學員的整體表現及其學業進境。

6. 通過教學問卷調查，全面了解學生對本科教學的意見。

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: The Creation Society
courses.description: The Creation Society is a significant literary group of the May Fourth period that shaped the literary history and cultural history of modern China. This course introduces the activities and representative works of the Creation Society in the 1920s. The transformation of the Creation Society and the significance of the change will also be addressed.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Chinese Fiction and Literary Trends in the New Era
courses.description: This course will introduce students to the development of Chinese fiction and literary trends after the Cultural Revolution, and the initial relationship between creative writing and literary criticism. The course will enhance students’ understanding of the principal concepts of various literary trends in the New Era of China. Through a close study of selected works, it will also examine writers’ reflections on Chinese literature in the Twentieth century.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: The Study of Semantics and Pragmatics in Chinese
courses.description: This course introduces students to the study of meaning in natural language (Semantics, Pragmatics), with a special focus on Chinese. It familiarizes students with the basic theoretical assumptions and tools in the modern theories of meaning and examines a variety of topics on nominals, classifiers, referentiality, quantification, scope, and discourse particles in Chinese.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Ci Poetry of the Song Dynasty
courses.description: Ci poetry emerged during the period of late Tang and Five Dynasties, and flourished in the Song Dynasty. Breaking new ground in both prosody and aesthetics, it is regarded as a representative literary genre of the Song Dynasty. This course provides students with knowledge of the development and evolution of ci in the Song period, through reading selected works and analyzing their artistic characteristics. The reception of the Song ci in Chinese literary history will also be discussed from the double perspective of traditional and modern ci criticism.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: The World, Life and Art of Du Fu, Li Bo, and Wang Wei: Three Master Poets of the High Tang
courses.description: High Tang poetry has long been regarded as the Golden Age of Chinese classical poetry. High Tang poetry boasts of the Confucian poet Du Fu, the Daoist poet Li Bo, and the Buddhist poet Wang Wei. These three master poets from the eighth-century China became an eternal source of inspiration to later poets, even up to now. This class introduces students to Du, Li, and Wang’s life-philosophy, experiences during the An Lushan Rebellion, and the aesthetics and achievements of their poetry.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: National Crisis and Literary, Cultural Innovation: Poets and Poetry of Ming-Qing Dynastic Transition
courses.description: Seventeenth-century China witnessed crises, transformations, and the Ming-Qing dynastic transition. The ethos of the poetry of the Ming-Qing transition demands a collective, almost fervent, effort to record and understand ongoing historical events, an effort often characterized by the pathos of introspection, retrospection, and mourning for the past. This class interprets, evaluates, and introduces to students a valuable but often neglected cluster of poems from the Ming-Qing transition.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Ming-Qing Fiction and Visual Culture
courses.description: The course offers a critical reading of Ming and Qing fiction, with a special attention to its conjunctions and intersections with the visual culture of the time. The texts to be read include: Xiyou Bu (Supplement to The Journey to the West), Li Yu’s short stories, Honglou Meng (Dream of the Red Chamber), and Lao Can Youji (The Travels of Lao Can). We will investigate the issues arising from literary texts and explore their broad ramifications for the art history and visual culture at large.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MA Chinese Language & Literature
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing this course, students will be able to:

1. understand the relationship between fiction and visual culture from the late Ming to the late Qing era.

2. learn to re-consider the issues of history of fiction from the perspective of art history and technology history.

3. develop their skills of close and critical reading on Ming-Qing fiction.

修畢本科後，學生能：
(一) 理解晚明到晚清小說與視覺文化的關係

(二) 學習從文化史、藝術史與科技史的角度重新思考小說史的議題

(三) 掌握明清小說的細讀與分析方法

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Fiction and Literary Culture in the Mid-Qing Era
courses.description: The course investigates the relationship between fiction and literary culture in the mid-Qing era, especially the Qianlong reign. The Qianlong reign was the very period when the Qing Empire reached its peak, but also the period when it began to decline. During this period, the traditional literati culture came to an end, and the influence and resources from the West were yet to come. The course helps students to historicize and contextualize the contemporary major fiction, Qilu Deng, Honglou Meng (Dream of the Red Chamber), Yesou Puyan, Rulin Waisih and Jinghua Yuan, to understand how the literati novelists responded to the challenges of their time.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MA Chinese Language & Literature
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing this course, students will be able to:

1. understand the relationship between fiction and literati culture in the mid-Qing era.

2. develop their skills of close reading.

3. learn to explore the research topics not studied in past researches.

(一) 認識清中期小說與文人文化的關係

(二) 掌握小說文本的細讀技巧

(三) 從小說文本中辨識出過往為歷史研究所忽略的文化史議題

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Selected Readings in Poetry in Han, Wei and Six Dynasties
courses.description: In the period of 200BC to 600AD, the self-consciousness in Chinese literature gradually emerged. Through exploration and discussion of a certain number of special topics, students in this course are expected to get a deep understanding of the characteristics and development of poetry in this period.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MA Chinese Language & Literature
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. 了解詩騷至唐詩兩座高峰之間的八百年中，中國詩歌發展的整體脈絡。

2. 了解漢代四、五、七言詩發展的情況。

3. 了解魏晉南北朝之際，建安、正始、太康、元嘉、永明等重要時代的詩歌風貌。

4. 了解宮體詩發展的原因及軌跡。

5. 了解隋代詩歌承上啟下之意義。

1. The understanding of the history of the Chinese poetry from 200BC to 600AD.

2. The understanding of the development of 4- 5- and 7-character poems in the Han dynasty.

3. The understanding of the characteristics of poetry in certain important periods between 200BC to 600AD, such as Jia An, Zheng Shi, Tai Kang, Yuan Jia, Yong Ming etc.

4. The understanding of the development trend of gong ti poetry.

5. The understanding of the pivotal role of the Sui poetry.

courses.subject: CHLL
courses.title: Cultural and Literary Trends, Hong Kong and Taiwanese Cinema
courses.description: The development of Hong Kong and Taiwanese cinemas have always been intertwined with the issues of Chinese history and cultural identities, which covers a broad geographic and historical terrain from mainland China, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Southeast Asia and the overseas Chinese communities. This course will discuss the cinema history of Hong Kong and Taiwan and how they were impacted by Western culture and literary trends, the Chinese diaspora, literary movements, the intellectuals and Shanghai handover, the Cold War influence on Asia, nationalism and the local identity. We will also consider how the Hong Kong and Taiwanese cinema histories have been written and whether films can truly reflect the cultural identity and history of Hong Kong and Taiwan.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MA Chinese Language & Literature
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing this course, students will be able to:

1. identify the characteristics of the major schools of literary and film theories, know the historical development of cultural trends well, and be able to identify the ways in which Hong Kong and Taiwan cinemas articulate, address, or relate to the distinct contexts of different Chinese communities of viewers.

2. apply the aesthetic, historical, socio-economic and cultural approaches in film interpretation and analysis.

3. analyze Hong Kong and Taiwan cinema from the viewpoint of Chinese and film studies research approaches.

修畢本科後，學生能：
1. 理解相關的西方電影理論、港台文藝思潮、文化潮流的發展脈絡，並掌握這些理論、歷史脈絡與港台電影的關係。

2. 除了學習從宏觀的文化角度討論電影，亦能掌握文本細讀的分析方法。

3. 掌握香港和台灣電影不同的流派及研究方法。
courses.course_syllabus:
1. 意大利「新寫實主義」與台灣「健康寫實」電影

2. 南來文化人、文藝思潮與上海/香港電影脈絡

3. 冷戰地緣政治‧華裔離散‧香港電影產業

4. 好萊塢類型電影‧文藝片‧1950 - 1960年代香港電影

5. 文化民族主義‧功夫片類型‧李小龍

6. 法國電影新浪潮與香港電影新浪潮

7. 法國電影新浪潮與台灣新電影

8. 文學與電影的結合：朱天文與侯孝賢

9. 跨國華人認同與李安

10. 懷舊‧香港寓言‧王家衛

courses.description: Traditional philology and modern linguistics, with emphasis on special topics, authors or schools.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MPhil Chinese Language & Lit or PhD Chinese Language & Lit
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. To acquire an in-depth knowledge in Chinese language and linguistics, and to enhance skills in critical thinking and ability to conduct independent study.

2. To develop both intellectual and technical abilities on research of Chinese language, literature and culture, and to familiarize with the general trends and recent findings in the research field.

3. To attain an advanced level of reading and writing skills in Chinese, and especially to master skills in academic writing.

1. 增進同學對中國語文及語言學的深入認識，並提升批判思考和獨立研究的能力。

2. 具備中國語言、文學及文化課題的研究能力，並了解相關研究範疇的發展趨勢及最新研究成果。

3. 提升中文閱讀和寫作的能力，並掌握學術論文的寫作方法。
courses.course_syllabus: 任教老師將就所選專題，提供課程大綱。
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. 導師經常徵詢學生對授課進度、課程設計、教學方式及個人學習的意見，俾能及時調整教學方針。

2. 為學習出現問題的學生提供個別輔導。

3. 利用導修報告及小組討論處理部分教學單元，俾學員主動學習，加強學員及導師之間的教學互動。

4. 利用 Blackboard Learn 的網上討論，加強學員及導師之間的教學互動。

5. 通過學習及論文撰寫，了解學員的整體表現及其學業進境。

6. 通過教學問卷調查，全面了解學生對本科教學的意見。

courses.recommended_readings: 任教老師將就所設專題，提供延伸閱讀的參考書目。

1. 導師經常徵詢學生對授課進度、課程設計、教學方式及個人學習的意見，俾能及時調整教學方針。

2. 為學習出現問題的學生提供個別輔導。

3. 利用導修報告及小組討論處理部分教學單元，俾學員主動學習，加強學員及導師之間的教學互動。

4. 利用 Blackboard Learn 的網上討論，加強學員及導師之間的教學互動。

5. 通過學習及論文撰寫，了解學員的整體表現及其學業進境。

6. 通過教學問卷調查，全面了解學生對本科教學的意見。
courses.required_readings: 任教老師將就所設專題，提供詳細的參考書目。
courses.recommended_readings: 任教老師將就所設專題，提供延伸閱讀的參考書目。

courses.description: In this course graduate students are required to report on their research results. Students should consult the supervisor/teacher about the content of their reports and prepare outlines prior to the oral presentations in class, which will be followed by general discussion.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in PhD Chinese Language & Lit
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. 掌握語言文字、古代文獻、古典文學和現代文學之研究方法。
2. 具備學術論文寫作能力。
3. 理解不同專業領域之最新研究概況。

1. Students will master research methodologies to four areas of Chinese studies: Chinese linguistics and phonology, ancient texts, classical literature and modern literature.
2. Students will improve skills in academic writing.
3. Students will obtain a good understanding of recent research in different areas of Chinese studies.
courses.course_syllabus: 任課導師指導下，哲學博士研究生按其專業領域(語言文字、古代文獻、古典文學或現代文學)提交學術報告，學習相關專業領域的研究方法及學術論文寫作。
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. 導師經常徵詢學生對授課進度、課程設計、教學方式及個人學習的意見，俾能及時調整教學方針。
2. 為學習出現問題的學生提供個別輔導。
3. 利用學術報告及課堂討論俾學生主動學習，加強學生及導師之間的教學互動。
4. 通過課堂討論及論文撰寫，了解學生的整體表現及其學業進境。
5. 通過教學問卷調查，全面了解學生對本科教學的意見。
courses.required_readings: 任課老師將就學生研究之不同課題，提供參考書目。
courses.recommended_readings: 任課老師將就學生研究之不同課題，提供延伸閱讀之參考書目。

courses.description: Regular meetings with supervisor to discuss progress of thesis research and writing, and to work on problems that arise from research.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MPhil Chinese Language & Lit
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. Students will master the skills required for writing academic papers.
2. Students will acquire a good knowledge of the research approaches and methods used in their discipline and other relevant disciplines.
3. Students will become well aware of the current status of academic research in their discipline and other relevant disciplines.

1. 掌握學術論文寫作能力。
2. 掌握自身專業範疇之研究方法，並旁涉其他相關範疇。
3. 了解自身專業範疇之最新研究概況，並旁涉其他相關範疇。
courses.course_syllabus: 任課導師個別指導下，哲學碩士研究生學習其專業領域(語言文字、古代文獻、古典文學或現代文學)的研究方法及學術論文寫作，並按其專業領域撰寫碩士論文。
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. 導師經常徵詢學生對授課進度、課程設計、教學方式及個人學習的意見，俾能及時調整教學方針。
2. 利用個別指導及討論俾學員主動學習，加強學生及導師之間的教學互動。
3. 通過個別指導及博士論文撰寫，了解學生的整體表現及其學業進境。
4. 通過教學問卷調查，全面了解學生對本科教學的意見。
courses.required_readings: 任課導師將就學生研究之課題，提供相關的參考書目。
